intro: Biophytum peruvianum, commonly known as the silver leaf plant, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a perennial shrub native to South America, particularly Peru and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, soft hairs. Its flowers are typically small and pale pink to white, appearing in clusters. Biophytum peruvianum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
